intro: Rottlera inophyllum, commonly known as the white rottlera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its fragrant white flowers and glossy evergreen leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and have a mild, pleasant aroma.
